channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-23184] CompileException Assignment conversion not possible from type "int" to type "short"
item.description:
CREATE TABLE MySink (
  `a` SMALLINT
) WITH (
  'connector' = 'filesystem',
  'format' = 'testcsv',
  'path' = '$resultPath'
)

CREATE TABLE database8_t0 (
  `c0` SMALLINT
) WITH (
  'connector' = 'filesystem',
  'format' = 'testcsv',
  'path' = '$resultPath11'
)

CREATE TABLE database8_t1 (
  `c0` SMALLINT,
  `c1` TINYINT
) WITH (
  'connector' = 'filesystem',
  'format' = 'testcsv',
  'path' = '$resultPath22'
)

INSERT OVERWRITE database8_t0(c0) VALUES(cast(22424 as SMALLINT))
INSERT OVERWRITE database8_t1(c0, c1) VALUES(cast(-17443 as SMALLINT), cast(97 as TINYINT))
insert into MySink
SELECT database8_t0.c0 AS ref0 FROM database8_t0, database8_t1 WHERE CAST ((- (database8_t0.c0)) AS BOOLEAN)

After running that , you will get the errors:

2021-06-29 19:39:27

item.summary: CompileException Assignment conversion not possible from type "int" to type "short"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I've looked into this issue and found that this is a bug in code generation.

In Java the following code cannot compile:

short a = 1;
short b = -a;

As -a results in an int value.

I'm taking this issue.
